name: Marco Beach Ocean Resort

reviews.text: I recently stayed at this hotel with a friend and her two teenage daughters. We flew into Fort Myers and booked a shuttle through Palm Air Transportation ($89.00 each way airport to hotel). The hotel is lovely, suites are huge. We booked this trip online and had booked a 1 bedroom suite, but when we arrived we found that the suites only have a king size bed, not 2 queens as we had requested. The hotel was able to upgrade us to a 2 bedroom and bargained a bit with the price difference. We paid a very fair price to upgrade for what proved to be double the space and two full bathrooms. The beach is beautiful, with attendants to get you settled on their comfortable chairs , position umbrellas and drink/food service right on the beach. One thing to be aware of, is that the beach is covered in shells which makes walking on it a little hard. Sandals and/or sneakers are recommended for walking. The pool area is on the small side, but we never found it to be too crowded and there were ample chairs, umbrellas, towels and two large tents to get completely out of the sun. Food and beverage was available at the pool also. All the suites have full kitchens and there are 2 major grocery stores just a $6.00 cab ride away. (Any cab ride on the island is just $6.00) There is a small plaza within easy walking distance with a book store, several restaurants, a movie theater and t-shirt/toy shop, but not much more. Having never been to Marco Island before, we were surprised to find that there really isn't much to do other than enjoy the beach. The few shopping centers had many empty shops and really weren't worth going to. There is a community playhouse, but it closes for the season around Easter time. If we were to go again, we would rent a car at the airport , as we could have explored a bit more of the area. This is a beautiful, quiet hotel with excellent service and we would certainly like to stay there again.
reviews.title: Beautiful beach, wonderful suites, great vacation!

reviews.text: I recently returned from a five night stay at the Marco Beach Ocean resort and I don't think they could have down anything better! I stayed in a one bedroom suite with a full gulf view (worth the upgrade cost!). The kitchen was well equipped - mini fridge, toaster, microwave and full cooktop and oven. The living room and bedroom were of ample size: the living room was equipped with a pull out sofa bed. The only drawback would be there is no indoor eating area/table. The room had a private balcony with a table and two chairs. The bedroom had plenty of storage space. The room I was in had a king size bed. The bedroom window does open - nice to listen to the sound of the waves at night!
reviews.title: Absolutely would/ will return for another stay!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach service was second to none... There are two other major hotel/resorts and an endless number of timeshares/condos that are beach front, but the Marco Beach Ocean resort does it best! Complimentary chairs, umbrella, sidetable along with towels and personal service are provided!! A full restaurant menu was also available beach side along with 3 pm complimentary sorbet daily. Other water activities were also available - wave runners, sailing, parasailing.....
reviews.title: Perfect resort, perfect weather, perfect delight!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool is located on top of the fifth floor roof - which would be breathtaking if it werent for the restaurant (Sale e Pepe) blocking the view of the ocean. Same services as beach were provided here. Personally - i did not spend anytime here! (Why would you with the ocean just steps away!)
reviews.title: Great find, great place, wonderful trip!

reviews.text: The service was impeccable! Everyone from the valets to waitstaff to housekeeping to beach attendants were extremely friendly, welcoming and helpful. The room was serviced twice daily (including turn down service).
reviews.title: Wow, What A Trip!
Great Hotel, lousy island
reviews.text: Great hotel, wonderful restaurant Sale e Pepe or whatever, I'm terrible in Italian.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The suites are geat, it's a world class hotel. But it's always about your neighbors and these folk get up by 8AM and start banging around. I'd hate to have bought a condo or time share and have some 6AM deaf guy upstairs yelling at his wife. They own part of the beach, great service down there also. Everything was wonderful except the pilled poly sheets.
reviews.title: This resort had it all!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sale e Pepe is a world class restaurant with a wine list that is only surpassed by a few hundred restaurants in the world (and those are for the most part in Europe and have verticals that can never be bought again). I'm an old man from the Midwest, own part of a sushi bar, and loved this restaurant. The early bird, see old man above, is three courses for $35 and you will drop that at any local joint for a lot less ambiance, view, taste, service, et al. The write up says "JACKET" but collar and slacks will get you in. The coots in the jackets next to us, with an incredible wine list, ordered Yellow Tail.
reviews.title: one of the best places we ever stayed

likes.disliked: — interior of the rooms is a litle bit outdated

reviews.text: Try the restaurant even if you don't stay here. And I guess it's OK to order Yellow Tail.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Place to Vacation
A few rude staffers ruined the stay
reviews.text: Our stay was amazing. My now sister-in-law was getting married on the hotel beach. Get a 2-bedroom suite with an ocean (gulf) view on the 12th floor..well worth the extra dollars. The room is HUGE. Very nice kitchen and the bathroom 'suite' was the ultimate. Grand soaking tub, extra long double-vanity and glass-encased shower. Large deck with an unbelievable of the beach and ocean, as well as the pool. Hotel staff, especially the concierge and valet parking...were extremely courteous and helpful. I frequently stay at hotels for business and vacations...and highly recommend this resort.

My family just got back from a 5 night stay at this property. The physical property itself is really gorgeous. However, they like to compare themselves to a Ritz Carlton type of property, and I have stayed at Ritz's....I believe this property comes up short in some important ways.
reviews.title: Nice but has some flaws

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds are really old and worn. They need to be replaced ASAP. I woke up with a small backache every day, and I am in great shape. Someone in lessor shape will probably have a really bad backache from the crummy worn out beds. Ours had very noticeable sags.
reviews.title: A Fine Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gym is small, and the equipment is old and crappy. One day the gym stunk really really really bad. I don't know what happened in there but it was TERRIBLE.
reviews.title: really lovely stay, would go again!

reviews.text: We ordered in room dining one night. The food was ok. Nothing great. We had much better down the street at a local restraurant.
reviews.title: Great place to stay - family friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool is nice, but a bit smallish.
reviews.title: Great location, food, and service.

reviews.text: The Marco Island beach resort is very nice. We actually we under the impression that we booked a room with two beds, but upon check in we found that our room only had one king bed and a pull out sofa in the livingroom. At first that were reasonable, offered us free valet parking the whole week and would move us to 2 beds the next day when they had a mass move out. The next morning that completely changed their minds, they were difficult and refused to stand behind their agreement. We ended up having to call out travel agent which was somewhat successful in getting us into a 2 bed room. The (2 bed) room is actually a 2 bedroom. It is very large a great for a family. The one room which we were in before is very small for a famiy. The pull out sofa is very uncomfortable and we just put one memeber on it and ordered a roll away. I have never seen this type of roll away, it was a blowup mattress for the floor. This just didn't fit the upscale quality of this hotel. The night before we slept at the Marriott where we flew out and their roll away was a great twin bed. Aside from the room confusion, when we finally got settled into our 2 bedroom it was very nice. The beach is great and the ocean was wonderful. The beach staff sets up your chair and towel and umbrella for you. That was so nice. The little bar and grill on the way to the beach is also very nice which we used several times. However it is extremely expensive. We ordered 2 cheeseburgers and chicken fingers and it was 85.00. One big downfall is there is no place on the property to eat breakfast. The bar and grill doesn't open until lunch. We ate breakfast in out room most days but would have really enjoyed a breakfast onsite. What we have done at other vacations is to eat breakfast in our suites and coverups and head to the beach. There are 3 excursions: Jetski Tour of the ten thousand Islands, Sailboat to one of the 10 thousands for shelling. You can also see dolfins in the bay which we did and our girls were very excited, Airboat ride in the everglades. All three and worth doing. One down fall of this area is that there really isn't much to do except beaching, and those 3 activities. We actually went for the beach so it suited our purpose. My husband loved it but our girls would have liked some more activities to choose from. We went shopping several evenings because their are really no evening activities. Lot of good shopping with in 45 minutes of the hotel. I would probaly return, make sure you know what room you are getting.
reviews.title: Beach Vacation with our family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I decided to stay on Marco Island to celebrate our honeymoon. Based on our research and on the reviews posted here, we booked a week at MBOR. (Funny, but there is no ocean nearby - the Gulf of Mexico, yes - but no ocean).
reviews.title: NICE, BUT NOT WORTH THE PRICE

reviews.text: We found the staff to be nice and helpful. Our first night in, we discovered that the folks upstairs had an extremely fussy baby. Now, why anyone would bring a small child to a place like this is beyond me, but we asked for a new room and were accommodated quickly and without fuss.
reviews.title: I've stayed at cleaner Holiday Inns!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are nice, but small. They have a stove/oven, fridge, microwave, some dishes/utensils and if you are up high enough, nice views of the Gulf. However, the beds are a little old, the carpets a little worn. I say this because if you decide to pay upwards of $350 for a night at a resort, you expect everything to be impeccable (at least I would).
reviews.title: A fine example of a luxury beachfront suite resort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, our stay was pleasant. We did not try the on-site restaurants - after reading reviews here it didn't seem to be a good choice. The hotel gave us a complementary bottle of champagne our first night -which was very nice. The concierge(s) were extremely helpful. Downsides were having to pay 18 bucks a day for parking with the ONLY option being valet. Which, of course, comes with tips. Beach service was okay, although there were a couple of staff at the beach who were EXTREMELY rude - they did not recognize us even after we were there for a couple of days, asked us for ID each time, if we got up from the chairs they were there trying to run us off the beach. Dwight however, was extremely nice and was a great worker (and asset to the resort).
reviews.title: Perfect location, Perfect Hotel, Perfect Wedding

aka: Marco Beach Ocean Hotel Marco Island
description: The resort epitomizes the AAA Five-Diamond standards. Marco Beach Ocean Resort features casual and elegant dining, a spa and fitness center, pool and hot tub, rooftop gardens, four miles of white sand beach and nearby golf, tennis and shopping. Complimentary smoothies on the beach and pool offered daily at 3pm. Wireless internet available complimentary to guests.
